Back:
Syntax: aws sts get-caller-identity [--endpoint-url ] [--profile ]

Description: Returns details about the IAM identity whose credentials are used to call the operation.

Response: JSON with UserId, Account, and Arn fields
Example: {""UserId"": ""AIDACKCEVSQ6C2EXAMPLE"", ""Account"": ""000000000000"", ""Arn"": ""arn:aws:iam::000000000000:user/ci-pipeline-user""}

Lab Example: awslocal sts get-caller-identity

Syntax: aws iam create-user --user-name [--path ] [--tags ]

Description: Creates a new IAM user for your AWS account. Does not create credentials - use create-access-key for that.

Response: JSON with User object containing UserName, UserId, Arn, CreateDate, Path
Example: {""User"": {""UserName"": ""ci-pipeline-user"", ""UserId"": ""AIDAEXAMPLE"", ""Arn"": ""arn:aws:iam::000000000000:user/ci-pipeline-user""}}

Lab Example: awslocal iam create-user --user-name ci-pipeline-user

Syntax: aws iam get-user [--user-name ]

Description: Retrieves information about the specified IAM user. If no user-name is specified, returns info about the user making the request.

Response: JSON with User object containing UserName, UserId, Arn, CreateDate
Example: {""User"": {""UserName"": ""ci-pipeline-user"", ""Arn"": ""arn:aws:iam::000000000000:user/ci-pipeline-user""}}

Lab Example: awslocal iam get-user --user-name ci-pipeline-user

Syntax: aws iam create-access-key --user-name

Description: Creates a new AWS access key and secret access key for the specified user. These are credentials for programmatic access to AWS.

Response: JSON with AccessKey object containing AccessKeyId and SecretAccessKey (ONLY time secret is shown!)
Example: {""AccessKey"": {""AccessKeyId"": ""AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE"", ""SecretAccessKey"": ""wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY""}}

Lab Example: awslocal iam create-access-key --user-name ci-pipeline-user

Syntax: aws iam list-access-keys --user-name [--max-items ]

Description: Returns information about the access key IDs associated with the specified IAM user. Does NOT return secret keys.

Response: JSON with AccessKeyMetadata array containing AccessKeyId, UserName, CreateDate, Status
Example: {""AccessKeyMetadata"": [{""AccessKeyId"": ""AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE"", ""Status"": ""Active"", ""CreateDate"": ""2024-01-15T10:30:00Z""}]}

Lab Example: awslocal iam list-access-keys --user-name ci-pipeline-user

Syntax: aws iam delete-access-key --user-name --access-key-id

Description: Deletes the access key pair associated with the specified IAM user. Immediately invalidates the credentials.

Response: No output on success (HTTP 200)

Lab Example: awslocal iam delete-access-key --user-name ci-pipeline-user --access-key-id AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE

Syntax: aws iam create-policy --policy-name --policy-document [--description ]

Description: Creates a new managed policy for your AWS account. Policy document can be inline JSON or file://path.

Response: JSON with Policy object containing PolicyName, PolicyId, Arn, DefaultVersionId
Example: {""Policy"": {""PolicyName"": ""CIPipelinePolicy"", ""Arn"": ""arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy"", ""DefaultVersionId"": ""v1""}}

Lab Example: awslocal iam create-policy --policy-name CIPipelinePolicy --policy-document file://policies/ci-pipeline-policy.json

Syntax: aws iam list-policies [--scope ] [--query ] [--output ]

Description: Lists all IAM policies. Use --scope Local for customer-managed, AWS for AWS-managed. Use --query for filtering.

Response: JSON with Policies array containing PolicyName, Arn, Path, DefaultVersionId, CreateDate
Example with query: arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy (when using --query and --output text)

Lab Example: awslocal iam list-policies --query ""Policies[?PolicyName=='CIPipelinePolicy'].Arn"" --output text

Syntax: aws iam get-policy --policy-arn

Description: Retrieves information about the specified managed policy, including the policy's default version. Does NOT return the policy document itself.

Response: JSON with Policy object containing PolicyName, Arn, DefaultVersionId, AttachmentCount, CreateDate
Example: {""Policy"": {""PolicyName"": ""CIPipelinePolicy"", ""Arn"": ""arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy"", ""DefaultVersionId"": ""v1""}}

Lab Example: awslocal iam get-policy --policy-arn arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy

Syntax: aws iam get-policy-version --policy-arn --version-id

Description: Retrieves the actual policy document (JSON) for the specified version of the managed policy. Use this to see the permissions.

Response: JSON with PolicyVersion object containing Document (the actual policy JSON), VersionId, IsDefaultVersion
Example: {""PolicyVersion"": {""Document"": {""Version"": ""2012-10-17"", ""Statement"": [...]}, ""VersionId"": ""v1"", ""IsDefaultVersion"": true}}

Lab Example: awslocal iam get-policy-version --policy-arn arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy --version-id v1

Syntax: aws iam attach-user-policy --user-name --policy-arn

Description: Attaches the specified managed policy to the specified IAM user. The user immediately gains the permissions in the policy.

Response: No output on success (HTTP 200)

Lab Example: awslocal iam attach-user-policy --user-name ci-pipeline-user --policy-arn arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy

Syntax: aws iam list-attached-user-policies --user-name [--query ]

Description: Lists all managed policies that are attached to the specified IAM user.

Response: JSON with AttachedPolicies array containing PolicyName and PolicyArn
Example: {""AttachedPolicies"": [{""PolicyName"": ""CIPipelinePolicy"", ""PolicyArn"": ""arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy""}]}

Lab Example: awslocal iam list-attached-user-policies --user-name ci-pipeline-user

Syntax: aws iam detach-user-policy --user-name --policy-arn

Description: Removes the specified managed policy from the specified IAM user. User immediately loses those permissions.

Response: No output on success (HTTP 200)

Lab Example: awslocal iam detach-user-policy --user-name ci-pipeline-user --policy-arn arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy

Syntax: aws iam delete-policy --policy-arn

Description: Deletes the specified managed policy. Policy must not be attached to any users, groups, or roles.

Response: No output on success (HTTP 200)
Error if attached: ""Cannot delete a policy attached to entities""

Lab Example: awslocal iam delete-policy --policy-arn arn:aws:iam::000000000000:policy/CIPipelinePolicy

Syntax: aws iam delete-user --user-name

Description: Deletes the specified IAM user. User must not have any access keys, policies, group memberships, or MFA devices attached.

Response: No output on success (HTTP 200)
Error if has dependencies: ""Cannot delete entity, must detach all policies first""

Lab Example: awslocal iam delete-user --user-name ci-pipeline-user

Syntax: aws iam list-users [--path-prefix ] [--max-items ]

Description: Lists all IAM users in your AWS account. Returns basic info, not credentials or policies.

Response: JSON with Users array containing UserName, UserId, Arn, CreateDate, Path
Example: {""Users"": [{""UserName"": ""ci-pipeline-user"", ""Arn"": ""arn:aws:iam::000000000000:user/ci-pipeline-user"", ""CreateDate"": ""2024-01-15T10:30:00Z""}]}

Lab Example: awslocal iam list-users

Syntax: aws s3 mb s3:// [--region ]

Description: Creates (makes) a new S3 bucket. Bucket names must be globally unique and DNS-compliant.

Response: Text output: ""make_bucket: ""
Error if exists: ""BucketAlreadyOwnedByYou""

Lab Example: awslocal s3 mb s3://ci-lab-dev-bucket

Syntax: aws s3 ls [s3://[/prefix]] [--recursive] [--human-readable]

Description: Lists S3 buckets (no args) or objects in a bucket (with s3://bucket-name). Use --recursive for all objects.

Response: Text formatted list with dates and sizes
Example: ""2024-01-15 10:30:00 12345 artifacts/dev/app.zip""
For prefixes: ""PRE artifacts/"" indicates a folder/prefix

Lab Example: awslocal s3 ls s3://ci-lab-dev-bucket

Syntax: aws s3 cp [--recursive] [--include ] [--exclude ]

Description: Copies a local file or S3 object to another location locally or in S3. Can copy to/from S3.

Response: Text output showing progress
Example: ""upload: ./build/app.zip to s3://ci-lab-dev-bucket/artifacts/dev/app-20241203.zip""

Lab Example: awslocal s3 cp build/app.zip s3://ci-lab-dev-bucket/artifacts/dev/app-20241203.zip

Syntax: aws s3 rb s3:// [--force]

Description: Removes (deletes) an S3 bucket. Use --force to delete non-empty buckets (deletes all objects first).

Response: Text output: ""remove_bucket: ""
Error if not empty (without --force): ""BucketNotEmpty""

Lab Example: awslocal s3 rb s3://ci-lab-dev-bucket --force

Syntax: aws s3 rm s3:/// [--recursive] [--include ] [--exclude ]

Description: Deletes an S3 object. Use --recursive to delete all objects under a prefix.

Response: Text output for each deleted object
Example: ""delete: s3://ci-lab-dev-bucket/artifacts/dev/app.zip""

Lab Example: awslocal s3 rm s3://ci-lab-dev-bucket/artifacts/ --recursive

Syntax: aws ec2 describe-instances [--instance-ids ] [--filters ] [--query ]

Description: Describes one or more EC2 instances. Returns detailed information about running, stopped, and terminated instances.

Response: JSON with Reservations array, each containing Instances array with InstanceId, InstanceType, State, etc.
Example (no instances): {""Reservations"": []}
Example (with instances): {""Reservations"": [{""Instances"": [{""InstanceId"": ""i-1234567890abcdef0"", ""State"": {""Name"": ""running""}}]}]}

Lab Example: awslocal ec2 describe-instances

Syntax: aws ec2 run-instances --image-id --instance-type [--count ] [--key-name ] [--security-groups ]

Description: Launches one or more EC2 instances with the specified AMI and instance type.

Response: JSON with Instances array containing InstanceId, ImageId, State, LaunchTime, PrivateIpAddress
Example: {""Instances"": [{""InstanceId"": ""i-1234567890abcdef0"", ""State"": {""Name"": ""pending""}, ""InstanceType"": ""t2.micro""}]}

Lab Example: awslocal ec2 run-instances --image-id ami-12345678 --instance-type t2.micro

Syntax: aws configure [--profile ]

Description: Interactively configures AWS CLI credentials and default settings. Prompts for Access Key ID, Secret Key, region, and output format.

Response: Interactive prompts (no JSON response):
- AWS Access Key ID:
- AWS Secret Access Key:
- Default region name:
- Default output format:

Credentials stored in ~/.aws/credentials, config in ~/.aws/config

Lab Example: aws configure --profile ci-pipeline
